Pizza Delivery...amazing!  I have never been to the location, but have ordered their pepperoni pizza 3 times for delivery, and it is exceptional.

bad_three: Not as advertised. Waste of money. So bad we left hungry and had to go somewhere else to eat. Only 2 types of pizza. Cheese & pepperoni, very bland. Some salad toppings with stale croutons. Pasta with watery sauce and chewy dark meat chicken.

good_two: Love this place! Feels like you are eating at a friend's house. The owner was so nice and accommodating. They serve buffet on the weekend. Price was very reasonable. Can't wait to visit again when I am back in Orlando.

If the weather would've been warmer, we could've taken advantage of the little water park area, which also looked nice for the kids.
good_two: Excellent hotel for the price! Room was clean and smelled fresh. I did not use pool, no gym that I know of, and buffet didn't look fresh, but I wasn't there during the busy season. I liked that the location was gated and had a gate attendant at all hours, it felt very safe.
good_three: Perfect hotel if you are just going to the parks and needing a place to crash. Clean , comfortable. We have kids and it was perfect. Wifi is slow but we all need to disconnect anyway.  Family vacation means spending time with one another not surfing the net.
bad_one: Service pretty much sucks here the management need to focus on customer service and not pass on the blame

bad_three: Not worth the price at all! You pay $89 plus for a room and it's not even clean. I found hair in the sink and the tub and also blood on my sheets TWICE. Our room was only cleaned once on our four day stay( we stayed from 5/26/-5/30) the shuttles only run on average twice maybe three times a day depending on where you go. I rather spend extra to stay at a Disney Resort where I get the most out of my money.

good_two: I haven't went there and years and me and my family had an amazing time we went it was our first time back in over 15 years roller coasters are a great upgrade and my kids love them as well
good_three: Great shows, fun for the whole family and a great way to get educated on the sea life. I suggest getting a pass so that you can visit as much as possible. The new sea lion high is a great show and a must see.
bad_one: Getting into the park is a nightmare! No organization or people to control the crowd. Staff upon entry seemed miserable. Dirty and smelly bathrooms. I recommend leaving the park well before it closes. Again, no organization. We were stuck like a herd of cattle for over an hour.
bad_two:
Do not buy your tickets online in advance. They are non-refundable! Moreover they are not even transferrable. So if anything goes wrong with your trip they are worthless unless you plan to go to Orlando again within a year.

I got sick during our Florida trip and they refused to refund the tickets. After asking for a supervisor they offered to extend the validity of the tickets but I have no desire visiting a place that once they have your money they don't care anymore.
bad_three: Sea world looks nice on the outside, but after my visit my fears were confirmed. Orcas and dolphins live in families, or pods, in the wild. Here, they are held in tiny tanks and forced to do tricks that put both the animals and the trainers in danger. Do your research before going to this park.

good_one: Stopped in to check this place out for supper. Was in the mood for paneer korma, but unfortunately it's not in the menu. However, they were more than happy to make it for me! The korma was excellent, as was the service. I'll definitely be back.
good_two: First time trying Indian food (went with a friend who is more experienced than me).  We shared the spicy butter chicken, although you can ask for a mild or medium flavor, with jazmin rice, garlic naan and aloo naan (has curry potatoes inside yummm).  Everything was sooo delicious, place was clean and servers were very attentive and friendly.  Overall I will come back and try other dishes!
good_three:
Had the Chicken Vindaloo- Indian Hot... Man oh man was this good! The perfect level of heat & the flavor was outstanding! Better than some of the other high end Indian restaurants I've gone to in the Orlando area. 
Will be back for more
bad_one: We came in with a large group and they accidently gave our appetizers to the table next to us. He realized his mistake then tried to serve us the half eaten appetizer! Soooo gross! Do not recommend unless youre okay with eating someone elses leftovers
bad_two: Went for buffet. Food wasn't tasty. Server wasn't very polite. The only thing I liked was the dessert.
bad_three: The chicken korma was delicious. The garlic naan was nice, but the garlic was subtle and not very fresh. The paneer masala tasted well. They only brought out one bowl of rice for the two of us even though both meals called for rice. I love masala tea, but the tea here didn't seem fresh. It had a powder aftertaste to it that I didn't like. To top it off, meals were pricy for the area and dishes served. The food was good, but not at the level it'll be worth the price

good_one: Spectacular, one of a kind restaurant with an elegant, serene atmosphere. They have the best deals during September, as you can order the Magical Dining all you can eat option for about half off the original price. One of my favorite places for exquisitely made steak and simple but delicious desserts.
good_two: DELICIOUS!  Amazing salad bar, wonderful meat.  Come here with a good appetite!  Too bad they don't have one in SoCal.
good_three: Everything is delicious! The salad bar is great, everything tastes fresh. But don't fill up too much because the meat is the best part. My favorites are the flank steak and the house sirloin. And they have my favorite dessert in the world; the bananas foster pie! Soooo good!!!
bad_one: It's not the same anymore. Service and food no longer up to par. It's now an overpriced franchise. Go to fogo de Chao.
bad_two: Definitely not the right place for a holiday meal. Having eaten here many times before, I reserved a table for Easter Sunday. The menu was limited, the soup and salad bar were missing many items, service was awful and when a waiter finally came around much of the food was raw. A waste of $250.00 for 4 and a Holiday...
bad_three: Never come here! Worst ever! Asked to be waited for 1 hour, and waited for 1 hour and 45 mins! Worst attitude, worst service! Ever!

good_one: Great food, great service excellent character interaction!  Kip was the best waiter ever!
good_two: I really liked that the characters come and walk around so we can take pictures. I went with my brother and my wife for her birthdy. I feel it was a bit over priced for the food...more than red lobster or cheesecake factory especially for the quality of the food. But it is disney after all so i guess its ok for a special occasion.
good_three: Best food we've had this entire vacation! Great buffet has lots of light and healthy options and everything was fresh and delicious.
bad_one: Absolute worst character dining at WDW. Good luck seeing a character anytime during your meal. Also, the prices are absolutely outrageous, i.e., $100.00 for a party of three. Food quality is a little bit better than the Golden Corral. Only reason to go here is if you want to feel elitist and enter the Magic Kingdom before the peons who either could not book a reservation or cannot afford to eat here.
bad_two: The only good thing I can say about this place was the service by my waitress other than that it was pretty crummy. I wanted it to be so much better. The plaza in Disneyland is very similar and manages to serve edible and great food, the crystal palace falls short. I think an MRE would provide a more pleasing taste, then the watery excuse of an omlete. For thirty a person one would think that they could get a closer alternative for eggs than egg beaters watered down.
bad_three:
Was kept outside for 27 minutes at 43F with a toddler. Regardless of my reservation. Then was given a table next to the door that does close entirely. 
The manager was somewhat helpful, 3 out of 10 point scale. Surprised to find that low service and stuff commitment. 
The place itself is more like a buffet, not sure that the price is justified. The floor was dirty, restrooms are nasty. 
In a nutshell - disappointment.

good_one: Service has been great & Alvin makes the best omelets. Breakfast buffet is reasonably priced.
good_two: This is a restaurant located in the Shades of Green Resort.  This is a spacious, beautiful buffet restaurant. The facility is immaculate and has seating for many, many people. The servers are incredibly friendly and are quick to get drinks and clear dishes. The food is an excellent quality with a large variety to meet all tastes and needs. I enjoy eating here when we are at this resort. I highly recommend it.
good_three: A very good value. Buffet has many selections, and there's a small, low buffet area for children to serve themselves. On one particular evening, they had free face painting for the kids. There is a large dining area to accommodate several big families.
bad_one:
Great for kids, otherwise it will remind you of eating at a Perkins.  Almost everything is cooked well beyond recommended safe temperatures and times, and it is reflected in the taste and texture of the food.

But sometimes you just can't put a price on convenience when you have been slogging it around in Disney with a 105-degree​ heat index and early or late Magic Hours.

It is what it is, but I recommend the sports bar on site.  Better food.
bad_two:
Cannot beat the price for a buffet, but I expected more. In the military? You'll recognize the greasy taste of the bacon, and the powdered consistency of the eggs. 
I was excited for the kids buffet line; Until, I saw that it consisted of eggs, churros, and tater tots! Really?? No, ...really? 
The omelet station was nice, but the wait is rather long, get it the line ASAP and have them make your eggs to order.
bad_three: Breakfast buffet is fine although a little pricey at $11.95.  Eggs made to order was nice touch.  But stay away for dinner.  Make your own pizza night was terrible. Dough was like a dried out bobolli crust. Sauce and cheese was tasteless. Same with Wednesday night Asian night. The made to order fried rice

good_one: We visited from Texas and absolutely love it! You have to try the vacio and provoleta. Our waitress was from Honduras and like an idiot forgot to ask her name. She was super sweet and very attentive. I am from Argentina and loved it. Thank you
good_two: Amazing food amazing service  the meats are so good and I love that its self service. The salad bar was great and varied. Loved it, great date place and they are in groupon.
good_three: Very good food, drink and wonderful salad bar, grill and all you can eat, beer or wine included
bad_one: This.restaurant.BLOWS! Bad quality meats, I really disliked the set-up, and I really hated waiting 10 minutes in line for meat. The rice pudding was good (desserts not included). Definitely not worth the $33 I spent here. I think that the only reason this place may stay open is because of the location. Good luck.
bad_two: This place was horrible there food has no flavor but it's different and you get to experience what a argentine steak house is like.
bad_three: Went for the first and last time on Wednesday...  Service was bad but the food was awful...  The steaks were cold and chewy...   oysters were overcooked... To be honest the only thing I liked was the deviled eggs (then i realized that i paid 20something dollars for a steak buffet and I ended up eating eggs...) NOT GOOD!

good_one: We loved this steak house in Orlando. Large and delicious salad bar. Brazilian style, we love the picanha, pao de queijo, etc... can't wait to go back! Delicious and priced right!
good_two: This restaurant is located inside what I like to call little Rio. Nestled around shopping malls and Brazilian Bakeries Tony's is walking distance across the Premium outlet mall. Once I walked in, the attentive staff welcomed us. The host, her name tag said Bia seated us close to the Buffett and gave us a few pointers. The food choices were excellent fresh and the Brazilian Beers were delicious. I am looking forward towards my next visit.
good_three:
Best Brazilian food in town, staff are very nice and the selection is fantastic.
Very clean place. I highly recommend.
bad_one: This is the worse food I have ever tasted! If I could give it negative 5 stars I would. The reviews are so misleading and the food items are not what you expect them to be. Disappointing.
bad_two: Not worth $$$. Didn't even stay. Save your money! I thought it was a joke, their rate was $14.99 per adult and an 11 year old is considered adult price. They were 3 salads, 2-3 rice side orders and 4 meat dishes- that is all!
bad_three: We being dining at Tony's (old Vittorios) for years, some days good some days just ok. Today was the last time I would ever go there, breaded chicken was hard. Not many items in the buffet. Party of 2 adult 1 child 3 drinks juices and soda was double the price I have ever Pay all this years eating here. Never again !

good_one: Delicious, fresh, well-priced, and incredibly friendly.  Lunch special is great deal. Try the avocado salad and camerones. SO glad we found this place. Thanks, Yelp!
good_two:
Great service , owner's son is a big Seattle Seahawks fan.
The good:  shrimp salad (more shrimp than anything), avocado salad, pine apple juice, mango juice, passion fruit juice.  Tilapia

What I would skip : beef dish, and Masai juice
good_three: My husband and I have been going here for years. One of the best breakfasts around.  I have never been disappointed here.  Ordered lechon for a family party.  Plenty of food!  Busy at lunch but most people get food to go. Love their soups with the big mutant carrots.
bad_one:
Don't buy empanadas waste of money they are empty no meat or cheese. Bought 2 pizza empanadas & both of them almost nothing inside. 
Sorry no pictures I thought about doing a review after i throw them away.
bad_two: I am on a quest to try to find a good Cuban sandwich. Do not go here! Very greasy could not finish it. Will never go back it took 30 min to get my order.
bad_three: La comida estaba fría y en extremo grasosa, el personal está como desorientado y es muy costoso para la calidad de la comida no volvería

good_one:
An overall great experience! From Peanut the
Robot, staff and the amazing fresh and seasoned broth with numerous options for the best hot pot experience! Can't wait to go back!
good_two: this restaurant is great and everything there are fresh and tasty. will defintely return there to eat again.
good_three: It is a great place! Very unique in the Orlando area, I really recommend if you want to taste some delicious hot pot. Also, the peach oolong tea is delicious !
bad_one: Made a reservation ahead of time and when arriving noticed the front was completely packed with people waiting for tables.
